report_title: Industry Research: Lipstick Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: The Lipstick Manufacturing industry has benefited from rising disposable income and a growing premium-level market. Consumer preferences and new product introductions have also contributed to revenue growth. However, the COVID-19 outbreak, rising inflation and rapidly changing trends have mitigated the industry's overall growth rate. Swift supply chain adaptation is necessary to manage these challenges. As a result, industry revenue has decreased at a CAGR of 0.5% over the past five years, including an estimated 0.1% increase in 2023, totaling $4.7 billion. Profit is projected to decrease to 5.1% in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue decreasing at 0.5% CAGR over past 5 years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Lipstick production revenue has been decreasing at a CAGR of 0.5% over the past five years, and is projected to reach $4.7 billion through the end of 2023. This includes a 0.1% increase in 2023 alone, while profit will likely decrease to 5.1%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 pandemic severely affected the industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic slashed consumer confidence and spending, leading to a drop in discretionary spending on lipstick products and disrupting supply chains.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Customers more conscious of products they use
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The growing consciousness among consumers about health and wellness has resulted in rising demand for natural, organic, vegan-friendly and cruelty-free beauty products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue expected to increase at 2.5% CAGR over next 5 years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Lipstick manufacturing revenue is expected to increase at a CAGR of 2.5% over the next five years, reaching an estimated $5.3 billion through the end of 2028, while profit rises to 5.2%.
Responding to consumers' increasing preference for eco-friendly, vegan cosmetics, manufacturers must reassess ingredients, shifting towards organic, natural, animal-free and metal-free compositions.

Consumers' admiration for high-quality, luxury cosmetic products will propel imports, specifically from beauty industry powerhouses like France and Italy. Foreign-owned enterprises will further infiltrate the domestic market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Social media and influencers to drive demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Celebrity endorsements and influencer collaborations on platforms like Instagram and TikTok will continue to attract consumer attention and boost demand for new, trendy products.

industry_definition: This industry prepares, blends, compounds and packages both cosmetic and therapeutic lip products. Products in this industry include lipstick, lip gloss, lip stains, lip liner and lip balm.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

key_trends: In recent years, high-end lipstick sales surged as the economy strengthened
The diversity in product offerings has opened doors for new manufacturers in the industry
Import rates have steadily decreased over recent years because of a rise in onshoring manufacturing facilities
Brands will continue to innovate and diversify offerings, making long-lasting and lip-nourishing products to meet demands
Foreign-owned enterprises like L'Oreal will further infiltrate the domestic market
Consumers' admiration for high-quality, luxury cosmetic products will propel imports
To remain competitive, manufacturers have been pushed to invest in research and development to come up with natural and safe products

market_segmentation.segment: Drug stores and beauty supply stores
market_segmentation.segment_description: Beauty and drug stores form the largest market for the Lipstick Manufacturing industry with their ability to sell both inexpensive and high-end branded products. Drugstores traditionally favored less expensive items but are now increasingly stocking up on more premium products. The expansion of beauty supply stores like Ulta and Sephora, which specialize in selling premium brands, amplifies their market control. Despite the growth of other markets in the industry, the contribution from beauty and drug stores has maintained a steady stance.

Department stores serve as a crucial hub for the retail industry, selling various high-end products sourced from various operators. Department stores face challenges because of decreasing mall visits, the boost of specialty stores and the increasingly popular e-commerce trend, resulting in a slight drop in demand. Some manufacturers, like Estee Lauder, have begun circumventing department stores by selling directly to consumers. Despite these challenges, department stores continue to attract customers with their diverse selection of high-end products.

Direct-to-consumer sales involve businesses selling their products directly to consumers, usually bypassing intermediaries like retailers or wholesalers. This strategy allows businesses to control their distribution while saving costs. Historically, companies like Avon and Mary Kay have thrived on this model, using a door-to-door approach to sell their cosmetics. The rapid growth of online shopping has significantly influenced consumers' buying habits. Online purchases are often more convenient and cost-effective than traditional in-store shopping.
The other market consists of local beauty boutiques, offering a unique shopping experience with a curated selection of exclusive and niche lipstick brands.

products_and_services.product_description: Lipstick, a cosmetic product primarily applied to the lips, plays a multifaceted role in enhancing one's appearance by improving lip color, texture and hydration. Matte and semi-matte lipsticks provide a flat, non-shiny look with high pigmentation and lasting power. On the other hand, lip stains, containing water, gel and often oils, provide a more permanent color using synthetic or natural dyes. The lipstick industry, especially the premium level segment, has seen significant growth because of trends favoring bold lip colors and its major consumer base - women who usually start using lipstick during adolescence.

Lip balm offers a dual benefit of cosmetic appeal and therapeutic relief, earning its commendable share in the personal care industry. Its purpose is to soothe and heal dry or chapped lips. Manufacturing lip balm involves a simpler and less chemical-intensive process, making it a cost-friendly option among other cosmetics. Its pricing, however, can vary depending upon the materials used, with premium organic ingredients like honey, mint and vanilla extract adding to the cost. The shift towards natural beauty trends and homemade lip balms has further boosted the industry, giving it a steady growth trajectory.

Lip gloss sets itself apart from lipstick because of its more diluted and liquid formulation, primarily composed of different waxes and oils. Formulated in various finishes - from frosted to glitter or metallic - lip gloss serves as standalone lip wear and a complementing addition to lipstick color in the cosmetic routine. Lip balm contributes greatly to the cosmetic industry because of its practical and dual-purpose beauty.

products_and_services.product_or_service: OTHER (E.G. LIP LINER AND LIP STAIN)
products_and_services.product_description: Other products include lip stains, lip liners and other lip products. Lip stain dominates the gamut of lip products in the makeup industry, owing to their lasting power, smudge-proof nature and less viscosity than traditional lipsticks. Lip liner and other varied lip products also find their share in the cosmetics market, ensuring diversity in choices for consumers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Return to Rich and Dramatic Lip Colors
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This fashion trend has helped boost lipstick sales and drop external competition from more muted industry substitute lip glosses and balms.

Lipstick products featuring natural and organic components are increasingly gaining favor on the market. This trend reflects wide concerns about the health and safety of products, growing concern over environmental factors and heightened interest in more sustainable lifestyle choices.

While most lipstick products are viewed as discretionary, they are not always cut out when consumers experience tough or uncertain economic times. Some consumers don't eliminate their use completely, but switch to lower price point products. At the same time, lipstick is often viewed as a small luxury, which many consumers indulge in when having to cut back or postpone larger luxury purchases.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The value of cosmetic and beauty product exports has decreased, partially because of the appreciation of the US dollar, which has caused US goods to be more expensive in foreign markets. Overseas retailers depend on the perceived high quality of US-made goods to entice foreign buyers, notably Canada, Australia and the United Kingdom. Rising e-commerce and social media platforms will prevent sudden decreases in exports.

international_trade_points.trade_title: U.S.-Based Companies Capitalize on Foreign Consumer Confidence
international_trade_points.trade_description: Glossier's online business model enables it to ship products to primary US export destinations, like Canada and the United Kingdom. Rising consumer spending in foreign countries has supported demand for US exports.

An appreciating US dollar has made imported products more affordable domestically. Demand for both high-end and affordable products has been increasingly satisfied by imports. Imports increased as domestic consumers with rising disposable income demanded discretionary products from European manufacturers.

Asian beauty products have gained popularity for their affordability and focus on gentle and natural ingredients. South Korea boasts innovative practices in the cosmetics sector, producing sustainable, eco-friendly and climate-conscious lifestyle products. The United States considers this eco-conscious approach a vital factor when purchasing lipstick products.

business_locations.location_description: Known for its fashion-forward metropolises, California has the highest concentration of industry establishments. California has a high population and many fashion-forward metropolises. Industry establishments locate manufacturing facilities close to downstream markets and save on transportation costs.

New York and New Jersey are the second and third most popular states for industrial establishments. New York City is home to many downstream customers because of its high population. This region is close to upstream chemical producers and contains significant shipping ports, which have become increasingly crucial to shipping within the US and for export destinations. Over the past few years, these major ports have seen increasing importance because of rising numbers of manufacturers engaging in trade.

This region has significant consumer destinations like Atlanta and Miami, with high population densities. Florida has several shipping ports connecting the United States to export destinations and imported low-price industry suppliers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA regulates lipstick manufacturing, enforcing laws on production, labeling and marketing. Although the FDA doesn't define organic cosmetics, some brands use the term. All lipstick colorants must be FDA-approved, often batch certified, controlling the allowable concentration for safety.

The Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act prohibits the distribution of adulterated cosmetics that contain a substance that may make the product harmful to consumers. The legislation protects consumers against products containing filthy, putrid or decomposed substances.

Under this act, lipsticks should adhere to proper packaging and labeling stipulations. The main display panel must accurately present information on ingredients and net quantity. The FPLA Act ensures consumers have the necessary information about the product's contents.

This act requires manufacturers selling lipstick in California to disclose any ingredients containing chemicals linked to cancer or reproductive toxicity. This regulation aims to offer additional protection and transparency to consumers beyond federal requirements.
OSHA ensures lipstick product manufacturers pay their workers fairly, set fair standards for overtime pay and ensure that they work in a safe environment.
The EPA regulates corporations to ensure environmental sustainability and prevent pollution. Specifically, it oversees lipstick manufacturers to ensure the substances used are safe.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The Food and Drug Administration is the primary regulating body governing lipstick product manufacturing, enforcing the laws and regulations relating to manufacturing, labeling and marketing.

Initiating lipstick production requires substantial machinery and industrial space investment, posing a significant financial hurdle for newcomers. Furthermore, research and development are critical for producing high-quality, cost-effective lipstick.
Building a brand identity and cultivating loyal customers is critical for product differentiation. Furthermore, manufacturers vary in price and quality, appealing to many consumers.

Capital remains central to lipstick product manufacturing, driven by significant investment in machinery. Still, most of the industry's employees work in production, but many are also involved in research and development.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies within the Lipstick Manufacturing industry are highly competitive with each other. In a mature industry with relatively low barriers to entry, manufacturers aim to stand out from the crowd in several ways.

Marketing and brand awareness are important bases of competition within the industry. The industry's largest manufacturers have extensive marketing departments overseeing far-reaching and often high-profile campaigns; however, this factor is less important in the niche and ultra-niche markets.

Quality is another important basis of competition for manufacturers. High-end lipsticks (or those perceived as high-end) carry a price premium, which boosts company revenue and profit. Premium packaging is often an indicator of product quality.

Research and development of new products is growing in importance as a basis of competition. In a saturated industry, companies look for new opportunities in untapped markets or to satisfy the unmet needs of existing consumers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: A low level of industry concentration promotes competitive dynamics.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Specialized small manufacturers are emerging to cater to specific niche markets
concentration_points.concentration_description: Consumers have become more interested in niche products like goods produced in small batches, creating more opportunities for small manufacturers. Despite the presence of major manufacturers, these smaller companies continue to find ways to thrive, offering unique products or services tailored to niche markets.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The cost of purchasing packaging materials represents a significant business expense. Purchase costs have decreased over the past five years and are estimated to account for 39.0% of industry revenue in 2023. The primary financial burden for manufacturers in this industry stems from purchasing raw materials like wax, dyes, essential oils and lotions. These elements are crucial to manufacturing and price fluctuations can significantly impact overall costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Product Success Depends on Research and Development
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs have increased over the past five years and are estimated to account for 45.1% of industry revenue in 2023. As the industry is mature and heavily saturated, new product innovation becomes essential to stay competitive. The trend towards products with restorative and protective properties and developing eco-friendly products further fuel the need for intensified R&D efforts.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Lipstick Manufacturing industry has a moderate level of capital intensity. For every $1.00 spent on labor, an estimated $0.23 is estimated to be spent on capital in 2023, which indicates that lipstick manufacturing is automated and lipstick products are mass-produced. Over the past years, the industry has come to rely more heavily on capital since employment is one of the easiest places to cut costs. Also, although a significant percentage of industry revenue is spent on research and development (R&D), only a small percentage of employees are involved in these activities.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Distribution Channels Play a Crucial Role in Lipstick Manufacturing and Selling
volatility_points.volatility_description: The lipstick industry thrives through numerous distribution channels, including department stores, cosmetic stores and supermarkets. These diverse channels help to maintain regular product supply and ensure a wide reach of customers. However, disruptions in these channels, like closures of manufacturing facilities because of public health crises or changes in consumer shopping behaviors, can lead to decreased demand and negatively impact industry performance.

volatility_points.volatility_title: International Trade Influences Lipstick Market Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Lipstick manufacturing faces volatility because of the influence of international trade. Low-wage countries like China supply competitive imports to the industry. Fluctuations in trade-weighted indexes determine retailers' and wholesalers' preferences for domestic or international lipstick choices.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: IBISWorld identifies a moderate level of technological change within the industry because of significant R&D expenditure to gain additional market share, a consistent rate of new product innovation and an escalating degree of automated manufacturing processes. Industry production generally involves mixing and blending readily available ingredients in batch operations. A wide array of chemicals is used in lipsticks, including emollients, antioxidants, pigments, oils and waxes to provide lips protection, color and texture.

Technological advancements have not disrupted the Lipstick Manufacturing industry. However, technological developments like 3D printing have allowed lipstick products to be produced less expensive and faster. Furthermore, artificial intelligence engines can mine huge data sources and produce personalized products that cater to all consumer preferences. These technological developments have not yet disrupted the industry's landscape but are starting to change consumers' access to cosmetics.
